p: Controlling for race/ethnicity and other covariates, low-income households had greater odds of believing in the importance of loans, tax breaks, rebates, or giveaways to encourage residents to install cool roofing (OR: 1.68, p=0.036) compared to higher-income households ( Table 4). Low-income households similarly had higher odds of placing greater importance in help with covering the costs of energy-efficient appliances (OR: 1.99, p=0.002), controlling for race/ethnicity and other covariates, as did Black (OR: 2.85, p=0.019) and Hispanic (OR: 2.14, p=0.006) respondents compared to respondents of other race/ethnicities.
